item.title: Event Sourcing Design Pattern
item.description: Event Sourcing is a powerful design pattern that has gained significant traction in the software development world. This pattern offers a novel approach to managing data changes, particularly in the context of microservices and modular monolithic architectures. In this guide, we will provide a detailed exploration of Event Sourcing, covering what it is, why it’s used, practical examples using C# .NET Core, the advantages and disadvantages, when to use it, and best practices.
